title: Todo List
description:
Build a simple todo list with add, complete, and delete functionality. ## Requirements 1. Create a function `createTodoApp(containerSelector)` that: - Takes a CSS selector for the container element - Sets up the todo list HTML structure - Returns an object with methods to interact with the list 2. The returned object should have: - `addTodo(text)` - adds a new todo item - `removeTodo(id)` - removes a todo by ID - `toggleTodo(id)` - toggles completed state - `getTodos()` - returns array of all todos 3. Each todo should have: - A unique ID - Text content - A checkbox to toggle completion - A delete button - Visual indication when completed (strikethrough) 4. Use event delegation for the list interactions ## HTML Structure The container should contain: ```html
    ```

testCases.description: createTodoApp returns an object with addTodo method
createTodoApp returns an object with getTodos method
addTodo adds a todo to the list
testCases.assertion: (function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('Test'); return app.getTodos().length === 1; })()

testCases.description: getTodos returns array with correct text
testCases.assertion: (function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('Hello'); return app.getTodos()[0].text === 'Hello'; })()

(function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('A'); app.addTodo('B'); const id = app.getTodos()[0].id; app.removeTodo(id); return app.getTodos().length === 1 && app.getTodos()[0].text === 'B'; })()
(function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('Test'); const id = app.getTodos()[0].id; app.toggleTodo(id); return app.getTodos()[0].completed === true; })()

testCases.description: New todos start as not completed
testCases.assertion: (function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('Test'); return app.getTodos()[0].completed === false; })()

testCases.description: Each todo has a unique ID
testCases.assertion: (function() { const app = createTodoApp('#app'); app.addTodo('A'); app.addTodo('B'); const todos = app.getTodos(); return todos[0].id !== todos[1].id; })()

hints: Use let nextId = 1 and increment it for each new todo
Todo object structure: { id, text, completed: false }
For renderTodo, create li with data-id attribute
Use checkbox input with checked attribute for completed state
In event delegation, check e.target.matches('[type="checkbox"]') for toggles
Check e.target.matches('.delete') or similar for delete button
